Production Manager Job at Dangote Group




        
    

        
        Dangote Group is one of Nigeria’s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard – earned reputation for excellent business practices and products’ quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Production Manager

Job Location: Obajana, Kogi 

Job Summary


	The Production Manager at Dangote Cement Plc leads and manages the Kiln operations to optimize production efficiency and quality of cement output.


Key Duties and Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Participate in the planning and development of a production strategy with tactical approach for DCP Obajana Plant to ensure safety of operations.
	Oversee the implementation of approved production strategy with respect to volume target in the plant.
	Ensuring the use of SOP to foster implementation of production processes and procedures to meet final product quality and achieve good efficiency level.
	 Manage daily Plant’s production plans, workforce and material requirement plans in line with DCP’s strategic intents.
	Demonstrate ownership and communicate the section’s strategic directions and objectives to all staff with respect to DCP’s aims, objectives and wholistic policies of the company.
	Coordinate and manage the production team to achieve daily production targets within specified quality level, budget and time.
	Identify weaknesses in the entire pyro process unit and following up with quality execution of refractory lining works in both the stationary and the rotary parts of the kiln, cooler, TAD, preheater cyclones etc.
	Prepare and provide sectional production reports and information to management to aid decision making.
	Supervise the implementation of approved recommendations such AFR installations, commissioning and operations of new equipment.
	Carry out other departmental responsibilities and jobs as assigned by the HOD such: training for human capital development, manpower rescheduling across all production lines, and light vehicles operational reliability/availability.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Chemical Engineering or a related field.
	Minimum of fifteen years (15) years of experience in cement production, with at least 7 years in a supervisory role.
	Relevant postgraduate qualifications or certifications will be an advantage.


Skills and Competencies:


	Strong understanding of cement production processes and operation of cement mills.
	Excellent leadership and team management abilities.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
	Proficient in production management software and tools.
	Commitment to safety and environmental standards.
	Ability to work well under pressure and make informed decisions swiftly.


Benefits


	Private Health Insurance
	Pension Plan
	Paid Time Off
	Training & Development
	Performance Bonus.

Social Media Officer Job at Intavalto Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Intavalto Nigeria Limited is a diversified technology company based in Abuja, Nigeria, specializing in smart home automation, renewable energy products, and infrastructure solutions. We support both public and private sector clients across Sub-Saharan Africa, offering services that range from planning and design to financing, construction, operations and maintenance of critical infrastructure projects. We're committed to technical excellence, sustainability and innovation, leveraging a skilled and diverse workforce.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Officer

Job Location: Kado Estate, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Job Description


	We are seeking a creative and proactive Social Media Officer to manage and grow our online presence across various social media platforms.
	The ideal candidate should be skilled in content creation, audience engagement, and basic social media analytics.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage daily content posting on social media platforms (Instagram, Facebook, X, LinkedIn, TikTok)
	Create engaging content (graphics, short videos, captions) aligned with the company’s brand
	Respond to comments, messages, and inquiries in a timely and professional manner
	Assist in planning and executing social media campaigns
	Monitor social media trends and suggest creative ideas
	Work closely with other team members to support brand visibility.


Requirements


	Experience: 1–2 years (NYSC Corps Members are encouraged to apply)
	Basic knowledge of social media tools and platforms
	Ability to create simple graphics or videos (Canva, CapCut, etc.)
	Good communication and writing skills
	Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.


Salary
N50,000 - N100,000 / month. 

What We Offer:


	Supportive work environment
	Opportunity to grow and build a strong portfolio
	Hands on experience in a fast growing organization.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrintavalto@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Reach out to: 070087777196.
